summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, discussing the urgent reconstruction of Special Housing Unit (SHU) review data (SROs) and inmate history reports (292 forms) for Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The emails detail his confinement periods in the SHU at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July and August 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for whom SHU review data and 292 forms are being urgently reconstructed following his death.

events.title: Epstein found dead in SHU cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his Special Housing Unit (SHU) cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on a Saturday morning.

events.title: Epstein's first SHU confinement
events.description: Epstein was held in the SHU for two days (July 7-8, 2019). No SRO review was conducted by the MCC for this period.

events.title: Second SHU confinement period begins
events.description: Epstein was confined in the SHU from July 10, 2019, to July 23, 2019. An SRO review was conducted for this period.

events.title: Third SHU confinement period begins
events.description: Epstein was confined in the SHU from July 29, 2019, to August 10, 2019. An SRO review was conducted for this period, which ended on the date of his death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his SHU cell at the MCC on a Saturday morning in August 2019, prompting an urgent internal data reconstruction effort.
Epstein was moved in and out of the SHU three times between July 7, 2019, and August 10, 2019.
Due to his 'notorious' status, there was an expectation that Epstein should have had more frequent Special Housing Unit reviews (SROs).
The email chain focuses on reconstructing Epstein's '292' inmate history reports and SRO data for the week prior to his death (August 5-9, 2019).
Technical challenges are noted in retrieving SRO review data from the DREV database table for an inmate housed in 'Z house'.
